Articles.Content:
Hi everyone

i'm a brazilian from Rio, and i've been playing KSP for like 6 months and i already want muh freedom back

jokes aside, i'm currently taking lessons to become a flight attendant, in a way to get money to pay for my piloting lessons (expensive as hell here in Brazil) and contacts (makes life in aviation so much easier ), my mother worked for VARIG and my father was a Flight Engineer, also for VARIG, and since i was in my mom's belly i was in contact with aviation, so thankfully there were no escape for me

as for Kerbal, i've been watching steam videos for a long time, always wondering how was the game, but i didn't buy it until a steam sale in early may... to be honest i regret buying it on sale, i've spent more with games i've played less (like most of my steam library, KSP is actually the second game i played the most, after only War Thunder, which will soon be surpassed by KSP), or games i haven't played at all because of my GPU (Tropico 5 for that matter), and it didn't take too long to get addicted to mods, maybe a week or less and i was already downloading Bobcat's Soviet and American packs, and the CSS, now i'm wondering which mods i can remove to save memory (i'm using ATM already btw), although i can't live without Raidernick's Skylab and Salyut, KW Rocketry, Bobcat's Mir, KOSMOS, KAS, SDHI and FASA's Apollo LEM and CSM...

and btw, even though i'm brazilian, and quite often i activate the "hu3 hu3 br br" mode i don't like killing my kerbals... i know, blasphemy, but sometimes i have feelings, and i don't like failing :3

Greetings!

If you want to train how to be a flight pilot, for Squad's sake, don't forget the FAR mod! As you may probably know if you lurked the forums enough, the stock aerodynamic model is astoundingly unrealistic, and in no way near to real life's. Additionally, for added bonus, try using the B9 Aerospace parts, although for that you'll need to sacrifice some(read: most) of your other mods, as from what I heard, B9 is very memory-hoggling.

Also, don't forget the International board, you may be able to contact with some of your own homewor-er, nation. I don't go there myself, though, as I prefer speaking in english, but that's for another subject.

Anyway, welcome to the KSP Forums!

thanks!

i use, but it's mostly against my will, just so Kerbin 10x RSS works, i don't want realism, i want fun, that's exactly why i got bored of FSX, i used to play as realistic as i could, then one day i flew an actual plane with a friend who is an instructor and since then it lost it's "magic" and i just wanted to have fun and not exactly realism lol

i've also used the most recent B9, but then i removed it since i didn't use the parts and i don't have enough creativity to make awesome ships with it

really neat, but i don't mind speaking english, i actually like it, this is one of the few ways i have to pratice it

There, I have exhausted my entire vocabulary learned while traveling Brazil this past summer for three months. I learned more but can only remember it after several caipirihnas.

Anyways, welcome and have fun exploding stuff!
